p: Limited studies indicate that rising temperatures will reduce the transmission capacity of overhead lines: this risk is expected to be low in the UK (Cradden and Harrison 2013), but may be significant in the USA at times of peak summer demand with reductions of up to 5.8% (Bartos et al. 2016). Increasingly, frequent storms are projected to present mostly low risks to powerlines in the UK (McColl et al. 2012), but may increase reliability indices by up to 30% in parts of Russia (Tyusov et al. 2017).
